column2: A microscopic fissure has opened between the material world and the Realm of Chaos. It is a fleeting event, quite beneath the notice of even the gods, but potent enough to invigorate the Winds of Magic power reserve.
Slayers belonging to your Clan are on a pilgrimage to Karak Kadrin and must not be disturbed.

A recent clutch of reports regarding ill-discipline in the lower ranks is cause for concern. Clearly, clods are being hired - this has to stop! Recruitment costs have risen accordingly, but new recruits begin two ranks higher.
This settlement has had technology stolen by a foreign [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero.
An arcane tempest has scoured this region, disrupting the Winds of Magic.
The spawnings follow the Great Plan. All things happen for a reason and the Skinks have their part to play: society must not grind to a halt!
The Dryads have been sent to the Wildwood.
No Lord who spills blood for financial gain can be considered honourable.

A battle-scarred Saurus Oldblood has come to your attention at the urging of the Mage-Priests. More feral than his brethren, he has a natural empathy with the great beasts of Lustria, who rally to him as one of their own. With much fasting and meditation, others are learning to commune in this fashion. As a result, recruitment costs for monstrous creatures have fallen factionwide.
Beautiful churches and breathtaking tournament grounds can now be built.
Allows the [[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]]pirate crew to construct ship buildings and recruit units directly to the vessel.
Your trade agreements have allowed for spying.
This horde is being severely affected by the current famine.
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for recruitment and replenishment, whilst raiding wealth from the local region.
New branches stretch to break through the forest's canopy and touch the sky.
The boughs spread, the vines grow, and life explodes from the Deepwood once more…
Purging the land of evil is a great thing, both for Bretonnia and indeed the wider world.
A Pirate Cove has been established recently, more time is required until we can efficiently establish another.
Your Chaos Sorcerers please the God of Magic and Change - expect a boon.

Prince Tyrion is the High Elves’ greatest living warrior. So valiant and skilled is he that the bards of Ulthuan sing that he is nothing less than Aenarion reborn - a tale that is given credence far beyond Ulthuan's shores.

The cheap, brittle mortar in your production centres is showing its age. Repair crews have been dispatched but the remedial work is disruptive, and income from your buildings has suffered as a result.
The Underway surrounding this army has been upgraded, enabling further movement.

Ha! Our armies overwhelm even the greatest defences!	true
effect_bundles_localised_title_wh2_main_lzd_born_killers_second	Let us not be reckless	true
effect_bundles_localised_description_wh2_dlc09_disable_crafting	[HIDDEN]	true
effect_bundles_localised_description_wh_dlc07_payload_event_filled_with_prayer	Dear Lady, we thank thee for the fruits of the land..."
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Bretonnian dukedoms.
The second your blade touches the web, hundreds of smaller spiders swarm from the darkness, engulfing you and your party. All is lost!
Your armies are focusing on cavalry training.

Wurrzag’s power and influence are beyond question. Those that know his abilities obey; those who do not, suffer. His retinue of Savage Orcs has vowed to stand by ‘Da Great Green Prophet’ to the end, and their strength has inspired countless other Greenskins to war in their turn.
Skull-adorned temples grow restless with power.
A Necromancer has been discovered in this region, practicing the dark arts in secret.
Recent events in this province have affected the local population's feelings in a negative way.

Teclis is Tyrion's twin brother, but two more different siblings would be hard to find. Where the curse of Aenarion has yet to leave an obvious mark upon Tyrion, it has made his brother frail and caustic.

Scurrilous rumours regarding this army's quartermasters abound. They issue the worst weapons and armour, keeping the best for themselves; they skim the rations and worse yet whisper mockeries of the Great Horned Rat! The rank-and-file are restive, and it's becoming increasingly expensive to bribe newcomers into joining - army leadership is down, and recruitment costs have risen.

In answering the call to form a brayherd, many of your warriors head off to fight, reducing the herd's numbers for some time. However, those who remain behind redouble their efforts to make up for the lack of numbers!
Such riches lost! But the Gods are content.
In Winter, the Oak lies dormant; Orion reduced to ashes, Ariel safe within its dark embrace.
Your armies within this province are literally falling apart.
You played the game, and you got caught; too bad. Goodbye.
You will receive the following effects while the Warriors of Chaos faction exists:
Though some Empire Lords worship the Ruinous Powers, it matters little. Filthy, Uncloven man-flesh is still flesh - human blood must still flow!
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.
A Hero is worth a hundred ordinary warriors; you must choose Saurus or Skink and open battle versus the internecine war of subtlety and surprise.
The whisperings spread throughout the lands.
The army is exhausted, almost as if their energy was drained by magical means...
Many human settlements lay in ruin - death and despair are rife throughout their lands. Continue on this course - seek an end to all mankind!
With Spring, Orion emerges from the Oak once more, renewed.
This army is suffering [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional losses due to a recent event.
When everyone aboard's a thief, it's essential to keep good records. The treasurer ensures each ship's log is maintained correctly.
Your escapades on the high seas led to the seizure of cargo that will be of high commercial value when taken to port.
During your antics on the high seas you acquired a bounty of lumber that will enable the rapid construction of buildings when returned to port.
One of our cults has been purged from the earth.
The Dawi are ashamed of the recent events.
The Oak's fate dictates not only the forest's wellbeing, but that of the Elven race also.
Recent events have led to an increase of Chaos corruption.
The herd moves, going where you tell them until their legs give out from the exertion!
His psyche restored, Arch Grand Commodore Luthor Harkon is back to his old, utterly terrifying self.
Ensure more Saurus warriors are spawned
Bloodlust fills our monsters, so their attacks find their marks.
Uses the Underway to traverse the world.
Your warriors fight on following the funeral.
Production must increase, and for that we need slaves! Each Lord is expected to deliver their due.
Seize the best architects and craftsmen, and confiscate private stocks of building materials! Your cities must grow!
You will never reclaim what is rightfully yours with so few troops! Tell the Lords to draft anyone capable of bearing arms immediately, on pain of death!
Perhaps offer a carrot instead of using the stick? Offer a rare bit of praise to one of your Lords, so that he may lead by example.
It is hard to cut through enemy armour without a weapon to hand.
The Centigors raid a nearby winery, bringing back barrels of suspicious liquid. The herd gathers and drinks... only to suffer a hellish hangover!

In pursuit of greater knowledge, the Skink Chiefs have been urging their artisans and engineers to meditate upon Ten-Zlati, the finder of the Lost Plaques, and to emulate his thirst for understanding. As a result, technology research rates have increased.

Burrowing and delving deep beneath the Vaults, your miner-prospectors have unearthed a vast Warpstone geode, untouched since the Great Catastrophe! This motherlode is the richest source seen in many years, and Warp-technology unit recruitment costs have fallen factionwide as a result of this enormous boon.
You employ a supposed 'expert' to cleanse the shrine. However, the charlatan does little more than set it on fire and demand an extortionate fee!
Although you resist the corruption of Chaos, others in your party are not so strong. Weaker minds are drawn to its power and are soon prostrate before the altar, praying to Slaanesh.
The power of Slaanesh is hard to resist. A tide of twisted thoughts and desires fills your head and you soon find yourself bent in prayer before the shrine of the Dark Prince.
It doesn't take too long to find someone with the power and will to cleanse the taint of Chaos. They safely purge the basement, as well as several other nearby relics.
The Trolls from the Chaos hordes in the north are migrating south, towards the Badlands.
Lileath is the patron of seers and prophets. She is prayed to for clarity, prophecy, and foresight - especially by one facing a great challenge, a difficult decision, or in need of some good luck.
Our Warlock Engineers should pick it apart and find out how it works!
Smash-kill-burn it! Skavendom is safe from this threat-menace now!
We have heeded Manann’s warnings and will move on with care.
Once again, your Branchwraiths rule the forest!
Bathe in the blood of your enemies!
Your Assassins have been greatly improved!
If the lesser-thralls wish to fight over such petty trinkets then let them. However, in reparation, it is only expected that tribute to you is increased.
The Wood Elves of the Moonspring Glades have struck upon a trove of information.

Durthu is an Elder of Athel Loren, a Treeman so ancient that even Ariel's millennia-long existence pales in comparison. It was he who first forged a union between Elves and forest, and he also who argued with his fellow Elders that the binding be made permanent.

Following successful raids on key targets in enemy lands, a number of enemy intellectuals have been 'acquired'. With a little persuasion, their skills and experience have been harnessed - they have been put to work improving the level of technology available to you in order that he might score further victories over the hated foe and bring about rightful Druchii supremacy. Just as you intended, the rate of research has increased factionwide, and requiring very little effort from anyone other than the slaves, whose lot it is to suffer and die!

Many years ago an old and respected seer disappeared into the Dragon Spine Mountains. Trackers were sent and a rescue expedition assembled, but to no avail. He was given up for lost... until now. His recent reappearance at  Caledor has prompted great rejoicing, and it transpires he spent his time in deep communion with an ancient Star Dragon who, sensing a kindred spirit, taught him much about the world's hidden Warp. As a result, your research rate has increased factionwide.
Bugman's legendary brew boosts the White Dwarf's already considerable might!
Your Warlock Engineers have been greatly improved!

Lokhir ensures Mathlann's favour by stealing, killing, and sacrificing in his name. Those who see Lokhir's famous Black Ark, the Tower of Blessed Dread, should prepare either for death or for servitude - the only fates possible for any of Lokhir's targets.
The Merwyrm has been slain by the empowered Star-metal Harpoon and now the beast has resurrected and in thrall to your Lord.
You'd think there'd be no need for surgery on a ship crewed by the dead, but you'd be wrong - someone who can sew limbs back on double-quick is worth their weight in grog!
The time has come to sacrifice our guests.
Recent events in this province have given the local population a reason to be happy.
You take their farms and steal their food to fuel your warriors.
The insidious, sickening Greenskins are coming!
They don't know why, they just remember. Remember that they want to be here, sailing the high seas for plunder.
The tracks are confusing and double back on themselves several times. In the bewilderment, you get turned around and eventually lose the trail altogether.
The peculiar hue covering our lands spreads fear and disorder among the dull and stupid peasants.

The vile, twisted creature known as Morghur is the essence of mutation and corruption given form. His coarse hair is woven through with gibbering, shrieking skulls, and his form flows and reshapes with every passing second.
The silken pavilions of the Radiant's carnival bring revels and joy to the fey folk of Avelorn.
Although no substitute for experience, enthusiasm goes a long way.

Reports are rife of Rat Ogres, Hell Pit Abominations and other monstrous units devouring the Skaven around them without warning. Is this the work of some foul saboteur from without? A rival who seeks to upset your rule perhaps? As a result of this outrage, recruitment costs for monstrous units have fallen but growth has taken a factionwide hit also.
The Troll King is possessed of a grim and malevolent cunning, seeking always to grind the realms of man under his monstrous rule.
[HIDDEN] Player only effect bundle that increases factionwide upkeep by 5% for each additional army
This Lord has got it right! Why aren't the others making similar contributions to the treasury?
NOT USED IN GAME Dragon orgre horn
Luthor’s mind is currently helmed by the personality most saturated with his self-promoting arrogance, only ever satisfied by destroying enemies in the most extravagant ways possible.
You have summoned a great king of the Ancients, now in your thrall.
Buried among the desert sands, the Tomb Kings’ guardians lie in wait for their prey, whilst also replenishing their own numbers.
Non-Chaos armies will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through these lands.

Luthor Harkon never chose to come to the New World, but fate decided that he must conquer this exotic land of the dead. Lustria conceals ancient secrets and great power. Harkon’s lust will not be sated until his Zombie army rules this land from coast to coast!
This settlement is recovering from a recent volcanic eruption. Restoration efforts are underway, but the population lives in despair of the event.
Our armies march well on full bellies, but the peasants may starve as a result. Oh well...

Valaya’s blessings, and her protection of Grombrindal, often manifest themselves in magical forms. All those who see the White Dwarf pass through their lands should count themselves fortunate, as Valaya walks with him.
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.
These warriors are mighty and terrifying, yet each one that leaves the forest to fight weakens it, if only temporarily.

A thaumaturgist in one of your provinces has been tasked with squeezing greater profit from industrial processes. Lost in thought one day while inspecting a smelting plant, he slipped and plunged into the roiling slag. His death was not in vain however, as the smelters discovered that the introduction of osseous matter worked to strengthen the metal, raising its value; profits are up factionwide!
As Dark Magic grows, seeping into the land, the dead no longer rest easy and those that live feel a terrible burden upon their souls.

The Great Warding teeters on its axis and weakens for a moment. Before it recovers, the Winds of Magic burst forth in a  tumultuous gyre around your army, greatly boosting their power reserve but increasing the likelihood of miscasts.
Balthasar Gelt is the Supreme Patriarch of the Colleges of Magic. He has only ever been seen swathed in shimmering, metallic robes and wearing a golden mask.
The Lady has granted us knowledge that will help us in the future.
War Standard o' the Corpse Surgeons

Khatep is the Grand Hierophant of Khemri, the head of the Mortuary Cult's hieratic council, and he alone knows all its secrets and unwritten lore. Khatep is the oldest and wisest of all the Liche Priests and the first member of their order to truly deny death's embrace, if not the ravages of time.
Over many battles and countless acts of treachery, Chieftain Tretch Craventail of Clan Rictus has proven himself a master of guile.
[HIDDEN] Player only effect bundle that increases factionwide upkeep by 4% for each additional army
A shortage of the Night Goblin's Mad Cap mushrooms mean that their effectiveness in battle has taken a substantial hit.
We have moved all our remaining resources to our fleets, but our settlements suffer as a result.

Having challenged you, this rival Beastlord has paid the ultimate price. As a result, your forces revere you as a leader of unwavering resolve even more than before, their lust for blood being heightened also.
Your Fleet Captains have been greatly improved!
Our tribe expands, taking more land!
Hellebron's personal cauldron is scarred and inscribed with the cruellest hexes, the pall of which emanates ever outward.
A new treasure map! What riches lie ahead?
Your Saurus warriors fight with bravery that fills you with hope, yet they also fall in great numbers before the foe.
Forcing the captives into slavery has improved this army's fervour.
In the deep forests dwell the mightiest, grizzled beasts. They only fight for a Beastlord who enjoys the darkest favour…
Devoted to the God of the Sea, Alberic and his elite, seafaring Knights rule the coastline with absolute authority.
What they do in the shadows is their own business.

Torture detachments have been deployed across your armed forces. While the Clanrats troops scavenge for goods and provisions, they set to work on the local inhabitants, clawing the locations of secret stashes and caches from their hapless subjects. Raiding and sacking income have both increased factionwide as a result of this excellent plan.
Your armies are focusing on melee infantry training.
Power is power - hunger, on the other hand, is fleeting.
Packs of Dire Wolves are flocking to your lands.
A shrine to the wise and just ruler of the Elven Pantheon.
On this rare occasion, there is a glut of ready and willing bodies to join the fray.
Many conflicts are won or lost on the strength of the first, vicious charge.
This banner takes the form of a legendary standard torn from the grip of its dying owner and desecrated.
This arcane fulcrum influences the Winds of Magic, offering magic-users in the area a far greater supply.
The boy was a fool, and his death was justified. We shall not attend.
Alarielle has recently visited this region. Those lucky enough to have witnessed her presence are left in no doubt that the Everqueen’s power is that of nature itself.
The brayherds gather around the herdstone in an orgy bloody greed - feasting on captives and the weaker runts or the herd. The Gors will be sated and healthy for some time.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Tomb Kings.
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Thirsting)
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Thriving)
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Dominating)
Old foes have turned their coats to our side - our ranks are replenished!
The recent killing of captives has left this force more capable of fulfilling the Old Ones' plan.
Chaos is rampant! It infests the area with its twisting, changing blight.

Though he appears to be little more than sixteen summers of age, Sigvald the Magnificent has blighted the world for over three hundred years; the personification of beauty on the outside, but rot within.

There are few kinds of monsters walking the world that Ungrim Ironfist has not slain in battle. Ungrim deals death - carving a path of red ruin before him while singing songs of old in a booming voice.
Archaon the Everchosen is the Lord of the End Times, the vessel through which the Dark Gods unite their followers and turn the whole world into a Realm of Chaos.
I am sure we can spare some extra bodies to ease the Liche Priests' burden.

It is whispered that elements of this army once visited Quetza, the defiled city, and were irrevocably changed by what they saw. Such rumours have reached fever-pitch of late and the Slann would do well to quash them! This army now suffers low leadership and increased recruitment costs.
The Wolves strike with such force it tears apart your foes!
Your warriors crave the blood of the Empire!
You have taken captives from among the raiders.
Let the rancid rank and file chatter and gossip, it means nothing. You certainly won't be aiding these irritating Grey Seers!

The new labourers toil under the Necrotects' whips. In time, Settra walks the path to the King’s Valley, where mighty statues of the gods, and kings of dynasties past, stand in eternal splendour. And towering at their head, Settra himself: a gleaming vision of polished marble, studded with glinting jewels and gold filigree. The tribute is a fitting one; Settra is pleased. The Necrotects and their new charges have served him well. He commands their deployment across his burgeoning new kingdom.
Word of this new wonder has spread throughout the kingdom. The denizens of Nehekhara feel pride, something they have not felt in an age. Settra rebuilds! Nehekhara will be made glorious again!
Once broken from arcane bindings, a Tomb Banshee is a truly terrible foe, as those in service to you now are.
You have instituted defensive training for this army's troops, teaching them to better anticipate incoming blows. All units now have improved melee defence capabilities.
Makes ready to capture a coastal settlement.
We cannot risk another outbreak, for the pox is virulent and crippling to the population.
Such a beautiful statue is truly inspirational to behold.
The ability to irrefusably challenge anyone - or anything - in their native language ensures that Wulfrik's Ruinous quest will never end.

Karak Eight Peaks is safe in Dawi hands once more and King Belegar sits once more upon its throne. Even though much of the Hold is in a state of disrepair, Clan Angrund have at least begun to regain their former glory.
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for building construction, recruitment and replenishment, regardless of territory.
No quarter has been shown to our enemies! Our troops rejoice at our success.
Your power is both feared and coveted.
Your have established yourself as a worthy power.
Word of your achievements has travelled far.
Your power is of little consequence to the world... yet!
The swarm grows in strength and confidence.
Vlad von Carstein is the first and greatest of the Vampire Counts of Sylvania. A master swordsman and skilled general with no small aptitude in the magical arts.

The slavemasters have been issued with a new style of lash coated with hundreds of tiny venomous barbs. Fearing its burning lacerations, the Skavenslaves are stepping up the pace. Naturally, army movement capacity has now increased factionwide.
[HIDDEN] Vortex ritual costs are doubled in MPC
The boy will be told, sternly, and hopefully he will think better in future.
Such quality, such opulence is sure to improve Bretonnia's reputation.
Your sorceresses have been greatly improved!
The Longbeards are grumpy, they gripe that while some grudges have been avenged, there are as many outstanding.

An exquisitely penned history of the Phoenix Lord Bel Shanaar has become widely popular. This artful blending of poetry and prose has caught the imagination of the people and has awakened within them a fresh hatred for Malekith and the foul betrayals of the Druchii. As a result, leadership and melee attack capabilities when facing Dark Elves have risen factionwide.
The curse of Undeath has taken root in this area and so the land begins to wither...
The tribute to the gods has placated the population.
The shadowed Night Glens are awash with forbidden and arcane magics.
The Liche Priests' work is for the benefit of all Nehekhara - give them all the resources they require.
Malagor is swift, as if riding the very Winds of Magic. His every step and word boils with corruption, and the Bray-Shamans who serve him carry out their horrific work with increased fervour.
Your Saurus Scar-Veterans have been greatly improved!
Tretch has scurried away, ready for a counterattack on his own terms!
Raids wealth from the local region.
The Lady will ensure that our gifted children are schooled correctly in the use of magic.
A severe blizzard has come scything down from the mountains in this region. Those not prepared will die.
Your Exalted Heroes please the Dark Gods - they are more effective than ever!
During your dalliances on the high seas you came across stranded crew, willing to join you in exchange for food and rescue.
Your exploits on the high seas have heralded benign weather, allowing for greater movement in these regions.
Your exploration of the high seas has borne fruit: a bounty of maps to uncharted realms, revealing more of the world.
During your adventures on the high seas you procured a bounty of rations to stave off attrition and ill-health.
As Dark Magic grows, seeping into the land, the dead no longer rest easy and those that live feel a terrible burden upon their souls.
Alith Anar's gruesome reputation spreads amongst the Dark Elves!
Demand they are sealed in the royal presence
Loec, the God of Deadly Dances, has given Anar a name - a Dark Elf whose own dance should end, war or not.
The only good Druchii is a dead one. To aid the war, Anar must hunt once more; now he knows the identity of his prey.
You welcome the visit from Ulthuan.
The sound of the bickering voices in Luthor’s head have been momentarily silenced, allowing him to regain some of his old powers – at least for now.
[HIDDEN] Gives the spawned horde free upkeep and the unbreakable attribute to the general
Your armies are focusing on cavalry training.
Lord Mazdamundi is the oldest and most powerful of the living Slann Mage-Priests. At the Dawn of Creation, he was instructed by none other than Lord Kroak himself.

The Council of Thirteen has decreed that the Warlock Engineers must step up their research efforts - on pain of death! A breathtakingly grisly list of execution methods has been circulated, each devised by the twelve earthbound Council-members, the thirteenth being, simply, a sacrifice to the Horned Rat. Unsurprisingly, your research rate has increased factionwide!
The Ruinous Powers demand a large sacrifice of blood!
The sky will turn black when our arrows are loosed as one!
The taint of Chaos skulks across the region, its touch starts to permeate the ground and twist the trees.
These jungles hold untold secrets, if you are bold enough to search for them!
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for recruitment and replenishment, regardless of territory.
Do not intervene in the pattern of spawnings
The Bosses have been scared into alignment.

A sharp-tongued troubadour is touring your lands, reminding his audiences of how Bel Shanaar succeeded Aenarion to become the second Phoenix Lord, denying the Witch King his birthright. Your subjects' hatred is whetted anew, their fury toward the Asur reawakened in earnest. Factionwide, your warriors now have improved leadership and melee attack when fighting against the High Elves.
Uses Shadow Realm Pathways to traverse the world.
Our cities blossom due to the efforts of artisans from abroad.
Kholek is a Shaggoth of tremendous age. He is one of the first-born kin of Krakanrok the Black, father of the Dragon Ogres. Where the Herald of the Tempest walks, a raging storm blots out the sun.
Your Death Hags have been greatly improved!
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Thirsting)
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Dominating)
Curse of the Sword of Khaine (Thriving)
Uses the Underway to traverse the world.
We cannot risk another smallpox outbreak - the peasant population is getting too low!
Your armies are focusing on missile infantry training.
Endowed with bestial cunning, the warherds can encircle the foe and strike from unexpected directions.
The peasants heed the warning. Just as well, for the alternative is death.
Strengthened, you press on to ever greater conquests!
Only the strong are fit to survive and thrive!
This one has walked through the fires of insanity, and found an ethereal strength on the other side...

One may fear the unknown, but as the true shape of a thing is ascertained - as its strengths and weaknesses are appraised - fear gives way to an understanding of its limitations. Through a recent educational program, your troops are coming to understand their enemies better and thus fear them less. As a result, leadership when fighting Skaven and Dark Elves has now increased factionwide.
This great swell has given our spellcasters a limitless pool of magic to draw from, but channelling so much power is dangerous for both the caster and those around them.
Your Khainite Assassins have been greatly improved!
The herd swells and grows, endlessly it seems! In a herd of such size each beast demands much flesh in recompense.

Arkhan the Black is the first and most loyal of the evil Nagash's followers. Arkhan helped lead the coup which brought the arch-necromancer to power, and he was the first, after his lord, to imbibe the Elixir of Life.
Yer Shamans 'ave done som right good spellcastin' of late.
Your armies loot and pillage across the Old World!
Skinks with skills of great use are saved, but the foulness spreads - Pestilens' takes a giant skitterleap toward victory and the Great Plan suffers a setback as a result.
With your plans for the Great Vortex completed, the road to total domination is now clear.

Seeking the gift of regeneration, an imprudent cabal of young magic-users has been dabbling in Ogre gastromancy. But disaster strikes, as they inadvertently summon the Great Maw itself! Smacking its lips with delight at the banquet laid out before it, the Maw devours the hapless sorcerers where they stand and disappears with a satisfied belch. This arcane upheaval has sapped the Winds of Magic factionwide!
Peace is achieved only when there's nothing left to kill!
The Shadow King will do anything to protect his realm. His warriors have learned of a threat that needs silencing.
The Shadowlands has a new enemy; the king must act and cull the threat before it festers into war.
Increases this army's vision and defence, allowing for Vanguard Deployment in battle.

Settra the Imperishable is the king of all Tomb Kings. He is a ruthless leader whose thirst for conquest knows no bounds. Settra's power is far greater than any other Tomb King, and his unyielding will is such that he never needs to return to his sarcophagus to rest.

Valaya’s blessings, and her protection of Grombrindal, often manifest themselves in magical forms. All those who see the White Dwarf pass through their lands should count themselves fortunate, as Valaya walks with him.
There are always more bones to be unearthed and reanimated…
Heinrich Kemmler burns with the need for power. Having recognised the limits that mortality placed upon him in his early years, Kemmler made it his life's work to escape them.
It has to be a mistake! This cannot be all there is!
The enforcement admiral is the overall fleet admiral's right-hand, making them second-in-command of the whole damned shooting match.
You will receive the following effects after the Warriors of Chaos faction is defeated:
Wurrzag has brought your tribe bad news and scorn of the Green Godz.
Your Spellsingers have joined their minds to the forest's sleeping consciousness and are at their best!
There will be new-found strength for our most loyal 'ands!
This army is struggling after giving up a source of fresh flesh.

Phakth is pleased with his tribute. As the knife strikes home and the Norscan exhales his last, a glow suffuses Settra's troop, and a bright beam pierces the firmament, highlighting a point of land far-distant. A Liche Priest produces a map and marks the destination.
There are bigger lizards to fry than this pathetic band. Onwards!
Funds are useful along the road to victory, but they do not win battles.
Your actions have emboldened the herd, increasing the efficiency of their toil.
As a result of your actions, the Beastmen herds now look more favourably upon you.
The Shaggoths and their kin are ready to honour their ancient pact to serve the Chaos Gods.
This warherd's low [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage is leading to loss of [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership on the battlefield.
The soul of the forest is sacred.
A stern warning should be sufficient to deter such behaviour.
With the death of Morathi, an age of enlightenment shall spread across a land once draped in shadow.
Nothing shall move the Shadow King, not even the wailing, screeching attacks of the Crone.
Makes ready to capture a settlement.
This [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero has stolen technology from a foreign settlement.

A Cold One breeder, reputed for his voracious pit-fighting animals, has exploited his trade-contacts to acquire certain rare fungi used by the Night Goblins. Thus dosed, his enraged creations are unstoppable against regular stock. In fact the compound is so effective than none will now bet against the beasts; there's just no sport in it! The pit-owners refuse to field them and sales have fallen off a cliff, so the breeder has offered you his surfeit of reeking 'shrooms. The answer, quite obviously, is "Yes!" Duly dosed, his Cold One units now have enhanced melee attack capabilities factionwide.

This province has declared a month of celebration in honour of the Everqueen. With poignant theatre, public dances, contests of wit, great feasts and a host of other cultural events. Hearts are lightened and the cares of the world fall way, if only briefly - for now, public order and army leadership have risen in this province.
This boon allows us to traverse lands that would normally cause us to suffer great losses with no worries at all!
The darkness dominates your soul. Only death can release you from its grasp!
The darkness is consuming your soul.
Fragments of an ancient tablet have been unearthed, chronicling matters from the age of the Old Ones. This is a cause for great celebration - both leadership and public order have risen here!
A darkness lurks on the fringes of your soul.

This province has seen record-sized litters in recent years and the population is booming. Packs of Skavenslaves and Clanrats swell and, as every young buck knows, there is strength in numbers. Both leadership and public order in the province have risen as a result of this good news.
[HIDDEN] effect bundle prevents this force from being ambushed
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.

Smallpox has devastated some of our villages. Who will plough the fields?
Our armies are crumbling due to this unfortunate weather.
Dirty guns either don't fire or blow up their gun crews. The gunnery master makes sure no aspect of cannon maintenance is missed.
No one knows much about Grimgor before he staggered out of the Blasted Wastes with the Immortulz, his bloody-minded bodyguard. Even for a Black Orc, Grimgor's thirst for war is exceptional.
During your antics on the high seas you acquired a bounty of lumber that will enable the rapid construction of buildings when returned to port.
Your escapades on the high seas led to the seizure of cargo that will be of high commercial value when taken to port.
You need meat to keep your warriors strong!
Melt it down to produce something useful. Hukon is not worshipped here.
What a great opportunity to provide suitable praise to Hukon? Have the Lord tied to the statue and publicly flogged!
Place the Lord-subject in a device that shall pull his tail until he chitters, then we'll see just how loyal he is!
Have Eshin follow this one, make it known that the watcher is always there and able to strike at any moment; this should ensure confession, yes-yes!

A new form of directed explosive has been devised specifically for weakening walls. Your sappers have been trained to burrow deep beneath the foundations before placing the bombs for best effect. Few survive the perilous process but no matter, for these new weapons are proving highly effective - enemy siege holdout time has been reduced factionwide.
Pirates have come across your trade routes and are attacking your ships.
This army is struggling after giving up a source of fresh flesh.
These armies will be stopped dead before they even embark!
The children will be trained in the ways of battle; they will be the finest soldiers in Bretonnia.
This army is currently subduing the local population and maintaining order. Its ranks will not replenish during the next turn.
Your Gunnery Wights have been greatly improved!
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
Giants do not make common cause with the brayherds, but if the titans are wandering close by, they join in the slaughter - tempted by snacking on Ungor!
Although unorthodox, the Phoenix King can move through court alone with a personal touch. Undermining the seneschal neuters his power elegantly.
Tzeentch's plot has come to fruition, aiding our cause.
Recent events in this province have caused positive growth.
Luthor’s mind is being controlled by his most craven personality, which would sooner have him cower behind his Undead minions before facing danger directly.
The citizens of our pirate empire have threatened rebellion against their overlords; it may take some time to root out all of these would-be rebels.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Greenskin tribes.
The herd is incensed and ready for war! Providing, that is, that war comes to them…
The merchants enjoy a taste of the food otherwise destined for noble tables.
In response to a hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's recent successful action, this army is on guard.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Vampire Counts.
The herd moves, going where you tell them until their legs give out from the exertion!
Mortkin's personal warhird were ravagers without peer; the glory of their many savage achievements is soaked into the ancient, tattered canvas.
The Gods look upon this horde and are pleased.
The corrupt forces of Chaos taint the land.

A new training regimen for your Heroes teaches them to veil their intent beneath a sheen of civility. After all, a killer with the manners of a rabbit is the most dangerous kind. The chances of successful Hero actions have now improved.
Your Loremasters of Hoeth have been greatly improved!
Grand Chieftain of the Deep Warrens
Recent events in this province have caused a negative growth.
Perhaps it is the combined help of all the gods, or maybe some hidden power within him, but when Grombrindal summons forth all his might no known foe can match him in single combat.
This army has undertaken a rigorous new training regime focused on frontline combat, yielding excellent results. All units now have improved melee attack capabilities.
Your faction will gain the following:
Your Wardancers leap to the opportunity.

column1: [[col:yellow]]Ulthuan is not fully under High Elf control[[/col]]

column2: It is unacceptable to declare war on another Bretonnian faction! Think of the code!
NOT USED IN GAME mammoth teeth
The land heaves and the corruption grows - the influence of the Ruinous Powers is keenly felt.

New targeting techniques have been introduced to your armies' training regimens, teaching the troops to focus on the enemy's weak points. Damage from missile weapons has increased factionwide as a result.
Increases this fleet's campaign map navigation range.
Clan Pestilens have an agenda we should all try to fulfil - filth-spreading and deviant destruction. Yes, yes, a hundred times yes!
[[col:red]]WARNING: The [[img:blood_voyage]][[/img]]Blood Voyage is currently active and is targeting Ulthuan - if possible you should prepare defences![[/col]]
A shrine to the harsh and ruthless God of Battle.
Your Werekin gain the favour of the Gods.
Your actions bring prosperity to Bretonnia; the outside world looks on enviously.
Your actions inspire your warriors and strike fear into your enemy’s craven hearts.
Your actions are saintly – the kingdom was built on such noble foundations.
The final gambit of the Chaos God Tzeentch has come to naught - or was that his plan all along?
The ability to bring down a Frost-Wyrm or Ice Drake marks one out as special among the sagas of the Northmen.
The consequences of your choice are not yet clear...
Your armies march on regardless, but there are some losses on the road.
The herd can replace their fallen with ferocious alacrity, yet the latecomers are more reluctant to fight.
If they wish to fight for freedom so much, they can go to Skavenblight and do it themselves! Begone!
Mortal armies will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through these lands.
Increase your Infamy by establishing piratical buildings in this settlement.
Men are reluctant to join the ranks of this army.
Politics are boring and this farce of a trial isn't even remotely amusing. This case is dismissed, let's have a feast instead!
They are all guilty of wasting your time, so all of them shall face your wrath! Unless each pays their weight paid in gold… before the sun sets!
The Blood Voyage has been spat forth from Har Ganeth; it is yours to command!
The food and drink sustains your warriors, giving them new strength to conquer enemy lands!
Conceals this army, allowing surprise attacks against passing enemies.
Give your enemies a taste of the blades of the Ancestors.
The army may be happy, but the land is not. Restraint is key to balance in nature.
Good-good! The pillar city, what the Dwarf-things call Eight Peaks, is Queek’s domain at last. Send the Clanrats forth to spray every chamber and tunnel in the urine-scent of Clan Mors.
You are taking territory thought lost for many ages, and losing fewer Skinks essential to the Old Ones' Great Plan. Onwards!
This province is suffering from a shortage of food.
Conflict in a nearby region has driven the inhabitants into your territory. This has greatly increased local tensions, but represents a rich source of cheap manpower for their armies.
Your warriors are troubled when doing battle with men.
Increases this army's campaign map marching range.
Summon the rumour-monger and have him explain his actions, then make him grovel and bow in front of your retinue. That'll teach him!
Have your own networks spread rumours of this one's meek paunch and short tail. Highlight that he stinks-smells like an Elf-thing's water!
The Gods honour your warriors with incredible might!
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
Your men struggle to make headway in the harsh ice.
Use the Worldroots to traverse the world.
Your fearsome warriors lay into the enemy with gusto, even when it leaves them open to attack! Even losses are part of the Great Plan and further spawnings are always possible.
Your armies are focusing on war machine training.
Unbeknownst to the citizens, followers of Chaos have infested this province.
The climate in this region is uninhabitable for your faction. All construction and recruitment times are increased and income, replenishment, growth and public order are reduced severely.
Perhaps it is the combined help of all the gods, or maybe some hidden power within him, but when Grombrindal summons forth all his might no known foe can match him in single combat.
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
The harbinger comes; storms wrack the forests in its wake. The Herdstones glow with dread and the Winds of Magic grow strong.
By the time you were done with him the poor, idiotic runt was no more than a smear of blood and fur. Next!
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
There is currently more than enough [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food for all Skaven to have their fill. For a change, even the poor among their number can afford to eat.
The Phoenix King demonstrates that he is above the games of court by publicly shaming this messenger.
In the deep forests dwell the mightiest, grizzled beasts. They only fight for a Beastlord who enjoys the darkest favour…
All occupants of these shoddy graves will be enlisted.
Recent events in this province have caused negative growth.
What the King hears, and when, is irrelevant. Supreme authority is his, always!
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
This army's [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenishment has been hindered by an enemy Hero's hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]action and is on guard.

Your realm grows, but it comes at a cost.
Turning from the eggs you begin your search of the nest. At that point, the Dragon returns and attacks! You manage to escape relatively unscathed, but there is a huge rend in your armour.
The throng looks to hearth and home, with feasts and stories by a roaring fire. It will be a while before this army seeks fresh recruits.
Recent events in this province have caused a positive growth.

Morathi's entire existence has been one of scheming and manipulation. Who knows how many of Aenarion's darker deeds sprang from seeds she planted within his mind, or how the history of the Elves might have been different had he not taken her as wife?

Conceals the army whilst moving, allowing it to ambush enemies along the way.
Your horde has negotiated an alliance. Your warriors see this as a cowardly act.
The everlasting night has come to this part of the realm, the corruption of Shyish is all but dominant!
Make your buildings stronger with the knowledge of the forefathers!
The Granter of Savage Hate sees our warherd for a brief moment, blessing the Gors with an exceptionally ruthless gift.
Monstrous strength, pushed to new heights… or is that depths?
Send a messenger granting a pardon but ensure he also mentions that the annual tribute will be double from now on.

Aranessa, the honorary daughter of Manann, accepts his gifts and serves as his sword in return for the Sea-God's favour. Her divine mission does not interfere with her great desire for treasure, however; if it glitters, it must be hers - empires will burn before she will give up her booty!
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Beastmen tribes.
You are currently integrating the new Gors - those acquired during the recent confederation between your herd and another.
Such is the age and renown of the White Dwarf that many sagas say he strode with the Ancestor gods themselves. It is a claim the White Dwarf does not refute...
Risking Khaine's wrath to spare your troops does have some benefits.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Skaven.
All will feel the strength and beauty of Alarielle – the bodies of those who dare defy the Everqueen will be pierced by her sheer radiance!
Your forces are benefiting from a protracted period of good weather; rations are plentiful and there's a spring in the troops' stride. As a result, army leadership has increased factionwide!

column1: [[col:red]]The inner ring of Ulthuan has been breached[[/col]]

column2: The Banner of the Hunter King
Your gut feeling was correct! You join up with the scavengers to search the ruins. However, after a few hours they disappear, along with some of your belongings!
This province is being severely affected by the current famine.
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
Binding the souls of its enemies has improved this army's replenishment.
The greatest shock for the Asrai was the discovery that they were not alone in the forest...
The herd can replace their fallen with ferocious alacrity, yet the latecomers are more reluctant to fight.
Entering the barn, you challenge the survivors and a stand-off ensues. Enraged by your arrogance, they refuse to surrender. Rallying together, they defame you as a tyrant.
Surprised by and failing to recognise you, they listen and agree to trade some of their excellent-looking weapons for supplies. The equipment turns out to be of superior quality.
Providence has brought you here to silence these agitators afore they can act! Their screams fill the air as the barn burns to the ground. Your people feel much safer in their beds.
You take the rebels completely by surprise. Overwhelmed, they surrender and turn over their weapons in return for their miserable lives. Naturally, you have them killed anyway.
These hunting grounds have improved the nobles' equestrian skills and made them happy.
In response to a hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's recent failed action, this character is on guard.
Dark Magic has surrounded your armies!
Your Liche Priests have been greatly improved!
Count Noctilus moved his castle in Sylvania to the Maelstrom known as Galleon's Graveyard, from there he wages war on all the living that dare sail his seas.
The nobles know these places well, so the hunt is over quickly - and with a favourable conclusion.
Death's wind billows around us, its presence strengthening our crew no end.
At court, the Phoenix King decries both as working against the unity of Ulthuan, hoping to shame them into silence.
This settlement is recovering from a recent flooding. Restoration efforts are underway, but the population lives in despair of the event.
Increases the favourability of the Winds of Magic when fighting battles.
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for replenishment whilst raiding wealth from the local region.
What price loyalty when there is a chance to acquire power?

A caprice of nature or something more sinister? Either way, this unusually long spell of bitter weather is taking its toll on your armed forces. Replenishment is down, but the appeal of guaranteed rations means new recruits are clamouring to join up, driving down recruitment costs.
The Skaven under your command are chattels, nothing more. Experiment away!

The Winds of Magic shift and grow, becoming powerful enough to be observed. Howling just beyond hearing, they cannot be heard, but can be perceived. The Chalice of Potions glows with a brighter aura, and all those who see it know its power. The Fay Enchantress wonders if this will be enough...
A strong army is essential to the Great Plan; your ranks swell with cold-blooded Saurus warriors, devoid of pity and mercy.
Sighting the Twin-Tailed Comet in the sky, the Grand Theogonist has decreed this to be a good omen.
In response to a hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's recent successful action, this army is on guard.
You bring down their walls and level their buildings, carrying off everything of value.
The most beautiful buildings in the land! The flower of Bretonnian architecture.
Yes, yes, Queek's plan, Queek's triumph. Others just following orders. Grovel before glorious Lord Queek!
Non-Chaos armies will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through these lands.
This force has been infected with a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague. It may spread to nearby settlements or armies.
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
This force has been infected with a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague. It may spread to nearby settlements or armies.
Let the court deal with the court's issues, and may the Mother guide him…
Let's see how he views the concept of loyalty one thousand years hence!

A brutish Gor - a pretender and nothing more - challenges the chieftain of the brayherd. The young-horn will pay for such folly - their horns adorning banners, and their hearts offered to the Dark Gods.
The weak, pandering Northmen are easy prey, and you recover what they have plundered with ease, expelling the tainted barbarians from Lustrian shores and back into the sea.
Long has Morathi held the secrets to eternal youth; they are kept from you no longer!
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
Moving at reduced speeds has enabled our casters to harness much more power from the Winds of Magic; both they and our army are reinforced with a new-found strength.
Reminders of their former lives induce rage in our Unliving Lords.
Makes ready to capture a settlement.
Your horde has negotiated a non-aggression pact. Your warriors grow angry at your cowardly acts!
Rejoice! We have been granted the Blessing of the Lady.
You'll feel their heat just a moment behind...
Your Necromancers have attained great power in their search for life everlasting.
[HIDDEN] When Chaos razes a region, apply this effect bundle
Weddings are boring. The Phoenix King has no intention of attending.
Take what you want to make yourself stronger!
The Bretonnians will pay dearly for such mistakes.
Circumstances have a chance to affect the loyalty of Lords.
The herd swells and grows, endlessly it seems! In a herd of such size each beast demands much flesh in recompense.
Bretonnia grows ever closer to uniting once more – the people rejoice!
Paranoia, although a sign of madness, doesn't mean they aren't all out to get you and you shouldn’t kill them first.
Sacred Banner of the Horned Rat
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
A close ally of yours has taken the Slayer Oath.
We had to sacrifice our troops' weapons; it will take us some time to ‘acquire’ new equipment.
Recent events are ravaging your hordes!
This mob's low [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness is leading to loss of [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership on the battlefield.
Our frontline has been reinforced by this lucky find!

A mage wielding the Lore of Life has agreed to travel with this army, but on condition that he does not have step foot near a battlefield. He reserves his art for the aftermath and, while prevention is always better than cure, it's hard to argue with his results. Following his recruitment, this force now has an enhanced replenishment rate.
This warherd's low [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]bestial rage is leading to loss of [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership on the battlefield.
You keep your plunder, but the Gods are not happy at the loss of their shrines.
Denying a Grey Seer his desires is its own reward, no matter the repercussions.
Your actions are courageous and show goodness of intent.
Our forces have suffered a considerable toll during this endeavour, but we have arrived in time to reanimate these recently-deceased seamen.
This contribution should please those damned Grey Seers, though your troops are none too pleased to be losing such valuable resources…
In the deep forests dwell the mightiest, grizzled beasts. They only fight for a Beastlord who enjoys the darkest favour…
Raids wealth from the local region.
There is a normal amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food available to the Skaven. The weak are starving and the strong are feasting - things are as they should be!

Cylostra’s performance for the Phoenix King would have been her greatest achievement, but it was cruelly snatched from her grasp by the cold depths of the Great Ocean. Now she has returned. No longer constrained by mortal bonds, her sole purpose is to perform – to show the world she is the greatest prima donna to ever have lived and died!
As you delve deeper into the caverns you become helplessly lost, and members of your party begin to panic. Clearly, it will be some time before you see the sun again...
This [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero must rest following the establishment of a Pirate Cove.
Your traders have excelled themselves! An over-abundance of quality building materials has appeared on the market, reducing construction costs.
Allows the Black Ark to construct buildings and recruit units directly to the vessel.
The fools continue to pay us for protection; once their loot dries up, who will come to save them?
The Gods have blessed your blades, although your smiths did not have metal to spare for armour.
Those troops in the service of a Tomb King should march with him into the afterlife, forever at his side.
Although the source of this sphinx's power is unknown to us, its strength cannot be denied!
The herd moves, going where you tell them until their legs give out from the exertion!
Love conquers all things; death is no barrier to the eternally Unliving.
The peasants are scared of the feasting.
The boyz are ecstatic after slaughtering recent captives!
A loud word, spoken in court, should be enough to silence their rudeness. At least for now.
These plans will help us greatly in our own research.
Khazrak embodies the rage of the Beastmen. Hunger for war, for flesh and, most of all, for revenge drives his journey across the great blood-grounds, at the head of the brayherd.
The translator gives back the book, his hands shaking. He informs you that it is a tome of great import, the contents of which will change the way we view the world forever.
The translator informs you that the book is an ancient treatise on warfare, full of forgotten tactics. With the appropriate level of study, it could tip the scales in your favour.
Your Skink Chiefs have been greatly improved!
Warriors, not workers, issue forth, ready to battle the forces of corruption! The Great Plan will take time to come to fruition, but they who threaten its progress are here now!
The example you set is inspirational. The Heroes under your command are proud to carry out your will, and do so eagerly. The cost for all Hero actions has fallen.
Such research uses valuable resources - resources that could otherwise be committed to the Great Plan - but strengthens the Geomantic Web. A trade-off, then…
More blades and armour lets you press deeper into the southlands!
Our lands will shine once again with the wealth and prosperity!
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
Whatever you do, remember to let go.
Sighting the Twin-Tailed Comet in the sky, the Grand Theogonist has decreed this to be a bad omen.
Those gods banished from our pantheon were exiled for good reason, we cannot risk their return to this plane of existence.
Their meaningless words are but idle chatter, and should be ignored.
Our forces are well equipped with state-of-the-art weaponry.
Your army grows in accordance with Sotek's wishes, but the benefits to the Great Plan that will surely be gleaned from these advances must wait.
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for building construction, recruitment and replenishment, regardless of territory.
Recent events in this region have led to a loss in income.
He must be hiding something! Take his eye, so it makes remaining one look at you in awe, yes-yes!
Test his loyalty-devotion, yes-yes! Have him slay his least-treacherous minion in front of you.
This grand admiral commands the entire fleet of ships, making the death-and-death decisions that effect the entire enterprise.
Wurrzag has brought your tribe good news and blessing of the Green Godz.
Raids wealth from adjacent land regions.
Promote unity by having the two rivals dance together.
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
Once a proud standard of one of mankind’s petty nations; it is now a wretched trophy blessed with all the Dark Gods’ malice and vainglory.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Dwarf throngs.
Many conflicts are won or lost on the strength of the first, vicious charge.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Vampire Coast.
Hordes that survive the gifts of Nurgle's Champions will be rewarded.
Trapped, you resign yourself to a long wait - it is some time before a retainer triggers the same mechanism and releases you.
You quickly remember that you have no idea how to read the runes before you, so escape by your own means seems unlikely. Your only option is to sit and wait for rescue.
The runes explain how to open the door using the complicated mechanism. They also reveal how to construct said mechanism and others like it; Dwarfish secrets? Not for long!
Your Wizards have gained meritorious awards from their college - they are at the height of their powers!
The Longbeards are fuming, many grudges have been left to fester, they rant about how this would 'never happen in their day'.
Get some Skavenslaves to purge-clean this mess now! Further experiments are forbidden-banned from now on!
The Banner of the Eternal Queen
Raids wealth from the local region.
The local citizenry can deal with the raid, leaving the hierarchy intact.

Oh, ye look at the sea, from the mists comes something might-y.

Yet, all is not lost, the verse is complete, for the song is a rune to bless the Star-metal Harpoon!

We’ll make a hole and steal its soul, for when Wulfhart’s weapon shall fly… the great Amanar will surely die!

Oh, ye look at the sea, from the mists comes something might-y.

Anchor the tides and slow the moons, becalm the waters for some hidden boons.

Break the waves, tame the sea; how big can one beast be?

With Spring, Orion emerges from the Oak once more, renewed.
Keeping every citizen of the Empire happy is not always possible.
The Oak's fate dictates not only the forest's wellbeing, but that of the Elven race also.
In Winter, the Oak lies dormant; Orion reduced to ashes, Ariel safe within its dark embrace.

As the Oak flourishes, its boughs and leaves cover Athel Loren and bring protection to the forest's occupants.
New branches stretch to break through the forest's canopy and touch the sky.

The last Cold One spawning yielded a rare strain, gifted with some notion of your venerable race's plight in their tiny brains. These beasts are so eager to fight for you that they barely need taming, and their urgency means that friendly infantry must trot to keep up. As a result, recruitment costs for Cold One cavalry units have fallen and army movement range has increased factionwide.
You are running on an [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber deficit - solve this as soon as possible!
The Gods look upon this horde and are angry!
Your armour has the favour of the Gods - a shame there was not sufficient metal for your blades too.
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
Your Mourngul Haunters have been greatly improved!
Mortals are restricted; their bodies can only take so much before they break. We are not bound by such restrictions.
Bretonnian law is just and true, as are its noble judges.
Damaged in recent combat, it will be sometime before the aircorps can be restored.
By currying favour with the Ruinous Powers, the herd grows ever stronger. However, dark favour comes at a price…
The Night of the Witches has arrived!
It is apparent that you have stumbled upon an abandoned Dwarf brewery. Naturally, you take the Dwarfs intoxicating ale and hold a great feast to celebrate your conquests!
Ever cautious of Dwarfen ingenuity, you gently push the third door open. Inside, you find a store room bursting with valuable trade goods that can be sold or bartered.
A rush of wind blows you backwards and there is a strange crackle in the air. You notice various runes around the room; this is a Dwarfen trap to nullify magic before it can be used against them!
Unfortunately, as soon as you prise the door open a powder keg explodes, throwing you backwards in the blast. Although the booby-trap failed to kill you, your wounds slow progress.
On this occasion, a letter; next time, the lance.

This army has discovered a legendary harem of Slaanesh. They may be some time...
Even in the lands of the eternal sun your warriors are supreme.
Your horde has negotiated peace. Your warriors grow angry at your cowardly acts!
Any man who complains of being tired will be left behind.
The herd is incensed and emboldened by their actions. They will now ravage and pillage with greater ferocity.

There's some really fine pieces here! After taking a few that take your fancy, your warriors take their pick of the remainder. Pleased, they pledge to fight with renewed fervour.
Having seen you cherry-pick the best pieces for yourself, your warriors are less than impressed with the leftovers; the brittle blades break on impact and the shields splinter when touched.
Possibly, you've misjudged your allies - they scoff at the poorly made weapons and begin to question your integrity. Sometimes, a good deed is its own punishment.
Send their souls to the Dark Prince!
The Granter of Savage Hate demands more slaughter! The Blood God imbues the warherd with a proportion of his rage.
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
There is no god a Dwarf would rather watch over them in battle; Grimnir’s gaze is directed firmly at Grombrindal’s force.
We have moved all our remaining resources into our settlements, but our fleets suffer as a result.
Amazed by your callousness, the survivors let out a string of curses as you walk away. They will all die, but it is too late to reverse the effects of their magical mischief.
Hear the choirs; is it the wind that brought back their cries? Once forged in blood by tragedy, sharp were the thorns of crimson death!
Increases the favourability of the Winds of Magic when fighting battles and enhances the effectiveness of spellcasters.

In a expression of deep and abiding respect for their winged mounts, a detachment of Phoenix Guard has journeyed to the Shrine of Asuryan, and performed a ritual to Aqshy, the Wind of Fire. Thus invigorated, Aqshy blows hard and fierce, in turn suffusing the Flamespyre Phoenixes with a newfound vitality. Even the Frostheart Phoenixes are impressed with this gift to their younger brethren. As a result, Phoenix recruitment costs have fallen factionwide.
Your fleets search the seas for battle!
Recent events have caused a decrease in this force's movement.
The wrath of Vanhel is harnessed within these golden ingots, primed for release in monstrous proportions.
A beautiful centrepiece of the frigid ocean, cursed by the Ruinous Ones’ rejection of those who worshipped them so vehemently.
A most rare mintage of Estalian silver, above which flying horrors of the sky seem to gather and circle.
You need the luckiest of lucky charms to tinker with the Dark Arts, especially if unprepared for their deathly consequences…
A mysterious glob of Athel Loren amber, enchanted to ensure that even dead flesh will never remain idle.
A true pirate sails ahead even if danger is certain.
The only Vorgo gold outside of the southern Grey Mountains is cursed with the anguish of hungry, insatiable ghouls.
The great warriors’ souls trapped within wait to be returned to this plain as terrifying sentries in service to the admirals of the night.
Only this final gold bar can manifest the trigger-happy apparitions that serve the Shadewraith’s ghostly turncoat captain.
Grombrindal shall become a vessel through which Grungni’s wisdom is transferred to the Dwarfs, but the lands within the Karaz Ankor that will benefit will be of his own choosing.
A wondrous sight indeed, dedicated to the blessed Lady of the Lake.
Your faction will gain the following:
The statue provides protection from evil, as if the Lady herself was standing watch over her flock.
Your wrath will be as merciless as it is bloody! Summon the troops and the populace to the central square. They shall have a spectacle they will not soon forget!
A great migration has arrived at your borders.

The clan's Warlock Engineers have found an ingenious use for their ailing slaves… bones are ground into a rich cement, making for an endless supply of mortar. Due to this most excellent development, building costs have decreased factionwide.
[HIDDEN] Player only effect bundle that increases factionwide upkeep by 2% for each additional army

A new decree has been passed, venerating the ever-vigilant Temple Guard. Performing displays of their peerless halberd mastery in the central plazas of the temple-cities, they swell with pride for their calling and your people are energised like never before. Temple Guard recruitment costs have fallen and public order has risen factionwide as a result.
The epidemic may reoccur and the enemy may attack at any time. Be watchful.
Recent events have provided a copious amount of flesh, ready for reanimation.
With no arm guards, your men get maimed more often.
Recent events in this region have led to an increase in income.
Mortal armies will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through these lands.
A repeat performance is very definitely in order!
The Gods smile on you as you bring death and destruction!
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Lizardmen.
Your Witch Hunters have been praised by the Order of the Silver Hammer for dedication in their prosecutions.
This settlement has been infected with a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague. It may spread to neighbouring settlements or local armies.
The extra teef came at a cost.
This horde is suffering from a shortage of food.
Sets up a defensive camp, enabling shipbuilding, recruitment and replenishment regardless of territory.
Our restored buildings will produce ever-greater troop numbers!
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for building construction, recruitment and replenishment, regardless of territory.
This settlement has been infected with a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague. It may spread to neighbouring settlements or local armies.
The weapons created here not only provide a literal edge in battle, but improve the leadership of those wielding them.

The Witch King is the supreme ruler of Naggaroth, and the eternal enemy of the High Elves. Long ago, he sought to claim Ulthuan's crown, but the Flames of Asuryan left him scarred by fire and twisted with hatred.
Your Captains have been given the 'Honour of Magnus'; they are highly respected by all.
Sets up a defensive camp, enabling recruitment and replenishment regardless of territory.
The Centigors raid a nearby brewery, bringing back barrels of mannish beer. The herd gathers to slake their thirst.
Recapturing Karak Eight Peaks will be no easy task, that much is certain. Another certainty is that all those joining this undertaking will require great compensation.
The Merwyrm Amanar has attacked this coastal region, and all have borne witness to its terror.
The Holy Order of the Silver Hammer have invaded our territory!
The speed of the horses ensures no enemy escapes with their life.

One of this army's lieutenants has attempted to curry favour with his captain using the largesse of his family's estate. The offer turned sour when the captain, looking more deeply into his subordinate's background, discovered his house to be a distant ally of Morathi. Publicly denouncing the Lieutenant - who has since left the service - should have worked, but the army's reputation has been harmed beyond immediate repair. Army leadership has fallen, and recruitment costs have risen as a result of this shame.
As a test of loyalty, force this Lord to turn in any deviant that has as much as whispered a word in criticism of your rule... starting with some family members!
This army has Rangers from a nearby region scouting the surrounding terrain for them.
A previously hostile Elector Count is ready to sue for peace.
The affiliates of the Ruinous Ones can no longer reach you, but you lose access to any artefacts or other items of use that may have served the Great Plan.
We have no need for mortals, who require care and sustenance beyond the binding spell. They won't make it out of the desert alive.
Gors of all strengths and ages are welcome here. All have their places, even those whose fighting prowess is less… developed.
Let the rancid rank and file chatter and gossip, it means nothing. You certainly won't be aiding these irritating Grey Seers!
A determinedly vicious and unhinged portion of Luthor’s soul controls this personality, occasionally making him think he is the Kraken itself!
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
A lot of food was lost during the witch-hunt. Oh well, it is only the peasants that will starve...
The climate in this region is harsh and unpleasant for your faction. Construction times of settlements are increased and income, replenishment and public order are lowered.
Our connection to the Winds of Magic is thinning, but should our forces crumble we will still have more than enough power to raise fresh troops.
[HIDDEN] Adds Chaos corruption to every province capital for the Chaos Rises event
The curse of Undeath has taken root in this area and so the land begins to wither...
