column2: Your armies are focusing on war beast training.
The seas are clear of enemies; we may travel with far less caution.
The everlasting night has come to this part of the realm, the corruption of Shyish is all but dominant!
All but a withered husk, Hellebron must bathe in the blood of the murdered if she and her coven are to be revitalised.
Volkmar has recognised the pious dedication of your Warrior Priests. Sainthood awaits!
How unfair! Why does Morathi not suffer this curse? Hellebron's true age is revealed without the lustre of Death Night!
All must bow before the Bride of Khaine, and even then they will be needed to fill the cauldron!
The Crone stalks the lands and her followers revel in the slaughter - such a wonderous time!
The Blood Queen is young - all who witness her beatific aspect are caught in its lethal glamour.
Like any cancer, Chaos' foul corruption must be cut out before it can spread. Replenish your forces later - a brand new spawning for the furtherance of the Great Plan!
The power of Nagash, emanating from his Black Pyramid, imbues your legion with endless energy and endurance.

Volkmar the Grim is the head of the Cult of Sigmar and the most powerful religious leader in the Empire. He is a pious and foreboding man, utterly devoted to the destruction of Chaos in all its forms.
Attaining level 1 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Attaining level 3 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Attaining level 2 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Beastmen brayherds are migrating across your territory, plundering the lands.
This mob's low [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]]fightiness is leading to loss of [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership on the battlefield.
The Longbeards are silent because there are very few grudges unaccounted for, much to their annoyance as they like a good moan.
The Undead are feasting upon corpses from the recent battle.

A sheaf of Elven architectural manuscripts dating from the reign of Caradryel have been discovered by your spies in the Old World. They detail techniques long forgotten, espousing principles so old as to be new again. As a result, building costs have decreased factionwide.
Makes ready to capture a settlement.
Such noble structures will stand while lesser buildings fall! Their swift construction will better serve the Old Ones' Great Plan for the world.
The Chaos Gods look upon your warriors' sacrifice extremely favourably - while your numbers may perhaps suffer, the corruption of Chaos spreads more insidiously than ever before!
The herd swells and grows, endlessly it seems! In a herd of such size each beast demands much flesh in recompense.
The world yields to those who master the Winds of Magic.
The refugees we intercepted have replenished our ranks, enabling us to grow our army considerably.
By currying favour with the Ruinous Powers, the herd grows ever stronger. However, dark favour comes at a price…
The Pearl of the Kraken Sea
In response to a hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's recent failed action, this army is on guard.
In response to a hostile [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's recent failed action, security in this province has temporarily been increased.
Let the streets run red with their blood. Khaine will be pleased this day!
They shall suffer annihilation and you will reap the benefits!
[HIDDEN] Adds Chaos corruption to every province capital for the Chaos Invasion event
Your exploits on the high seas have heralded benign weather, allowing for greater movement in these regions.
Your exploration of the high seas has borne fruit: a bounty of maps to uncharted realms, revealing more of the world.
During your adventures on the high seas you procured a bounty of rations to stave off attrition and ill-health.
During your dalliances on the high seas you came across stranded crew, willing to join you in exchange for food and rescue.

In a drive to improve combat stamina across your armed forces, the High Quartermaster has been experimenting with new ration combinations. His latest concoction is a bowel-addling patty of horse flesh, pickled fish and Forest Spider spinnerets, served between toasted discs of sweetened bread. They haven't a clue what they're eating but the troops can't get enough. Army replenishment is up, but due to frequent toilet stops, movement range is down.
Recent events have purified the lands.
Whilst you search elsewhere, rumours of the Undead presence spreads. Your people are outraged that you would place plunder above their safety.
You order your troops to attack from range. With impressive precision the Undead are taken down in one volley. This remarkable feat cheers the troops and improves their leadership.
Gors of all strengths and ages are welcome here. All have their places, even those whose fighting prowess is less… developed.
Recent events have led to an increase of Chaos corruption.
You are running on a critical [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber deficit. Your troops are now unsustainable - solve this immediately!
We can use this powder to quickly expand our tunnels, yes-yes!
The forest has reclaimed its child.
The warm, damp weather has created ideal conditions in the nests of forest spiders.
The secretary ensures quartermasters have everything they need to keep their vessels on course and on time.

Skarsnik is a meddlesome and cunning Night Goblin, preferring to taunt and torment his opponents rather than swiftly killing them. Ever the sneakiest of his kind, he leads his forces on feints and duplicitous manoeuvres that leave his enemies bewildered, beleaguered, and - eventually - destroyed.
Make it happen - we will continue to use these waters.
This building shall not fall. We shall see that it is restored.
We had to sacrifice our troops' armour; it will take us some time to ‘acquire’ new equipment.

A reputed Skink artisan has been dispatched to oversee construction work throughout your provinces. His guidance has highlighted where efficiency is lacking and savings may be made. Building construction costs have now decreased factionwide.
It is as though the Old Ones themselves speed your troops to ever-greater victories over the foe… until they fall, and become abominations unworthy of their sacred legacy and the Great Plan.
The taint of Chaos skulks across the region, its touch starts to permeate the ground and twist the trees.
Your warriors crave the blood of Bretonnia!
Increases this fleet's campaign map navigation range and line of sight.
Attaining level 2 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Attaining level 3 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Attaining level 1 allegiance to this God will reward you with the following:
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with menfolk.
Truly, a shameful act and one that will not be soon forgotten.
Orion is the King of Athel Loren and consort of the Mage Queen, Ariel. Although all Elves are long-lived, he is immortal - calling the Wild Hunt each year in defence of the sacred forest.
You are running on a severe [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber deficit. Your troops have begun to desert you - solve this immediately!
The recent execution of captives has further tempered this force for war.
Bring the fight right to their door. Remember, dead men tell no tales!
The herd drink and eat all night long. Your encouragement of such gluttony has boosted their leadership no end!
A blade is the only tool needed to destroy the enemy.
Things may move a little slower until Athel Loren is... curtailed.
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
There's almost no [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food to be found and the Skaven are in trouble: the masses are starving and the powerful are eating their underlings.
When Battle Wizards wander, the Undead suffer.
The sudden expansion of territory has caused instability throughout the land.
More than ever, your Waystalkers are attuned with their forest homeland.
By currying favour with the Ruinous Powers, the herd grows ever stronger. However, dark favour comes at a price…
Although the battle against the Jabberslythe has greatly improved your troops' experience, the beast nevertheless turns some of them mad.
Your faction will gain the following:

A fashion for devising new and more exquisite forms of torture has developed among the lower ranks, and they are practicing it every chance that they get! A tongue under duress may reveal many secrets, after all. As one might expect, the income from raiding and sacking has increased factionwide.
As your men begin their search, there is the sound of giant gears whirring into life. The entrance to the vault is suddenly blocked by a huge boulder!
A gift from the Crow, or a curse? It is but a matter of perspective.
Your encounter on the high seas is not one the crew or troops will readily talk about, yet they have gained regenerative abilities since the event…
Your exploration of the high seas has led to blessings from the Lord of the Deeps – your troops will be protected from harm while they have the Elven God’s favour.
Your exploits on the high seas has led to the salvage of arcane imbued blades, enhancing your army’s combat skills.
Your escapades on the high seas have lumbered your army with a curse… losing their sanity in a blood-induced frenzy!
During your adventure on the high seas you salvaged heavy armour and an arsenal of weapons.
Khalida Neferher, the Warrior-Queen of Lybaras, is highly respected across all the lands of Nehekhara. Her intelligence and bravery are as legendary as her intense sense of honour and justice.
You have managed to recruit experienced, veteran slavers.
Karak Eight Peaks has been taken by those annoyingly persistent stunty gits. If the name of Skarsnik is ever to strike fear into his enemies’ meagre hearts again then it must be recaptured. Now!
The recent murder of captives was a pleasing and instructive entertainment for this force.
There is a distinct lack of able and willing bodies to join your forces for the ongoing wars.
Raids wealth from the local region.
Caledor are powerful and mystical; they must be placated.
Our armies grow in size and ability!
For Khaine to reign supreme – as god of gods – Chaos must be stripped from these lands.
The Famine-Fiend stalks the land, emerging from the woods to leaving nothing but barren wastes and withered crops in his wake - for that is Slugtongue's curse..
Your Tomb Princes have been greatly improved!
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
These brave Dawi are celebrating after another wrong has been put right.
Gors of all strengths and ages are welcome here. All have their places, even those whose fighting prowess is less… developed.
A darkness lurks on the fringes of your soul.
The darkness dominates your soul. Only death can release you from its grasp!
The darkness is consuming your soul.
Increases the favourability of the Winds of Magic when fighting battles and allows for a small amount of replenishment.
Although they are our enemies, we belong to the same race. To destroy their settlements would be villainy indeed!
Cothique is the first line of coastal defence; do not let them wallow in insignificance.
Every Elven death is a tragedy. The Phoenix King feels compelled to say something.

The Liche Priests bend to their work. As the Norscan is swiftly denuded, he babbles the source of his wealth: Ice Tooth Mountain. His outsized skeleton is soon back on its feet; it is an impressive specimen indeed. Settra commands it to lead the way to the resting-place of his crown.
This boon will enable us to reach shores far further away than is usual.
The warriors are relieved, but the populace has been left in disarray.
Our nobles take what they want, but naturally this has slowed production somewhat.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Norscan tribes.
Your armies move with care, though much slower than usual.
The land heaves and the corruption grows - the influence of the Ruinous Powers is keenly felt.
The Winds of Shyish fill your sails, powering them ever onwards across the Great Ocean to victory and its spoils.
The Dryads have been put to the torch.
Your efforts pay off, although focusing your resources thus takes it from your grand Saurus armies and risks their strength against the insidious foe.

Uncommonly clement weather has driven the gargantuan denizens of the seas further north, resulting in an easy season of raiding and pillaging across the ocean for the reavers. Now, the streets of Karond Kar throng with fresh slaves, ripe and ready to be distributed around Naggaroth. Due to this influx of fresh labour, building costs have decreased factionwide.

Your silver-tongued traders are outdoing themselves; they could sell a beard to a Dawi and make it seem a luxury! Now, the holds of your trade-ships are packed to the gunwhales with exotic goods and levies are at an all-time high. As a result of this mercantile excellence, trade income has increased factionwide.
Your forces must be bolstered before encroaching further.
When first learning the ways of Necromancy, one's powers improve and increase with each night that passes.
These ancient writings contain knowledge yet untold.
Those who go to battle with the Everqueen's personally hand-woven banner do so proudly, and never waver.

The newly-elected Emperor is Karl Franz, Prince of Altdorf and Elector Count of Reikland. Franz is already garnering a reputation as a great statesman and warrior but has yet to prove himself as sovereign.
Power is power - hunger, on the other hand, is fleeting.
Tell him without telling him - if he seals documents out of sight, the paper trail will soon reveal his corruption.
Though tattered and ancient, this banner causes forces to charge - in the name of the Hunt - before the main Elven host.
Your [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes are performing at a higher level.
These men are feeling confident after cleaning up stragglers from the recent battle.
Armies of the Undead will suffer losses due to [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through these lands.
The Engineers' Guild recognise greatness and wisdom in your kin. Your Engineers are more effective than ever.
Recent events have purified the lands.
The greatest Bretonnian leader since Gilles the Uniter, King Louen is a mighty warrior-king – the very pinnacle of Knightly perfection.
This advantage must be taken, even when it draws power from the world. The Great Plan is robust enough to survive a minor deviation such as this.
Grombrindal sets out for the Chaos Lord at lightning speed, leaving barely any time to prepare his army.
Karak Eight Peaks is once again the prized possession of Skarsnik, ‘Warlord of the Eight Peaks’! Now, all effort must be expended to ensure it remains that way.
The plaque is easily recovered, and the ritual successful; your Saurus Scar-Veteran will turn the blades of your enemies with even greater ease!
The engineer oversees all maintenance and repair work undertaken to keep the fleet afloat and in good fighting condition.
The denizens rejoice at the recent completion of a ritual.
The shrine goes up in flames, taking the rest of the building with it. Better safe than sorry - you torch the surrounding area also before moving on.
Following a complicated ritual you are able to cleanse the shrine and remove the taint of the Undead from the room. You no longer have the feeling that you are under observation.
The shrine goes up in flames, but as the dust settles a ghostly figure rises from the ashes. This is not the result you had in mind...
A great migration has been turned away.
The ships are ready for warfare!

Crone Hellebron has ordered Death Night be extended by two further nights this year. The streets of Har Ganeth are awash with blood and viscera as its inhabitants release their pent-up, year-long furies in a breathtaking orgy of bloodletting. As a result, Death Hag and Witch Elf recruitment costs have fallen, and their starting experience level has increased.
The merchants in your lands are holding back supplies.
While raiding and despoiling, Beastmen appease their Gods and gather vile spoils.

Daughter of the mad Count Otto von Drak, Isabella is much like many of her noble counterparts: she is vain, immoral and selfish, and cares little for anything that does not affect her personal comfort or standing.
All battles fought by Bretonnians are glorious by their very nature.
A harpoon of tempered star-metal, the only weapon strong enough to pierce the heart of Amanar...
Your Vampire is a count in more than just name; he is a true noble and dread Lord of the Undead.
As your retainers stamp the patch flat the air becomes thick with spores. It isn't long before the taint of Chaos becomes apparent in their eyes and on their skin!
After inhaling the fungus your retainers are full of vitality but a strange glint in their eyes reveals the cost of this new found strength. Time to enlist some new followers, methinks!
It's probably best not to take any chances. You flatten the patch, removing the temptation of Chaos from the path of any and all who pass by.
Hearing of your refusal to accept handouts - even from the Dark Gods - Beastmen from all over flock to your banner, desiring to fight under such an assured leader!
As the Oak flourishes, its boughs and leaves cover Athel Loren and bring protection to the forest's occupants.
New branches stretch to break through the forest's canopy and touch the sky.
In Winter, the Oak lies dormant; Orion reduced to ashes, Ariel safe within its dark embrace.
With Spring, Orion emerges from the Oak once more, renewed.
The Oak's fate dictates not only the forest's wellbeing, but that of the Elven race also.
Your Thanes are likened to the heroes of the Golden Age - they are more effective than ever!
Ellyrion are fine cavalrymen and loyal; do not do them a disservice.
Hateful auras protect our veterans from cowards who fight at range.
They are complaining too much. Perhaps examples should be made?
Striking our foes swiftly and with great vigour, to relieve them of their lives and valuables.
Solve Treasure Maps by digging for treasure at the locations hinted at in the riddles.
You fight bravely but are soon overpowered by the Skaven's overwhelming numbers. They take care to ensure you are unable to follow them before disappearing.
Your actions honour Bretonnia, its people, and their way of life. For the Lady!!!
The horde grows in numbers and power - it truly is an Undead force to be reckoned with.
Truly this material is a gift from the Old Ones - a bounty that will wipe the enemies of the Great Plan from this world! If only it had not been warped in the aeons since…
Recent events have caused a hindrance to your forces' movements.
Your Nobles have been greatly improved!
Chaos is rampant! It infests the area with its twisting, changing blight.
You rush into battle eager to spill blood for your Gods!
Men are reluctant to join the ranks of this army.
Your Necrotects have been greatly improved!
The Chaos Gods look upon this army favourably.
Supplies of the dead have run low in this area.

There are many veterans in your empire, employing the skills they learned through armed service in the civic sphere. Engineering, geology, cartography… these are noble and useful pursuits, but war beckons! Perhaps the time has come to re-acquaint them with their blades? Recruitment costs and starting experience have both increased factionwide as a result.
With your plans for the Great Vortex completed, the road to total domination is now clear.
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
As the forest regenerates, so too do the Wood Elves…
You will receive the following effects after the Warriors of Chaos faction is defeated:
Your armies are focusing on artillery training.
More Saurus warriors are required to defeat the Ancient Enemy's foul taint. It is a shame they were not spawned earlier, for Chaos' foul corruption now blights your lands and must be forced back!
Use the wisdom of the Old Ones
Destroying its enemies has strengthened this horde.

column1: [[col:green]]All of Ulthuan is under High Elf control[[/col]]

column2: Your faction will gain the following:

Your trade supervisor has recommended slashing import duties at ports throughout the empire. Trade is booming as a result, and many Nobles approve of  this action, though it means less taxes for Elven coffers. As a result, influence has risen but port income has fallen, factionwide.
Recent events have positively affected public order.

A bitter blood-feud between two lieutenants in this army - one feared and respected, the other universally loathed - has been swiftly dealt with. Perhaps too swiftly, for in his rage, the wrong Elf was slain. As a result, the army's leadership has fallen and recruitment costs have risen too.
Your Mages have been greatly improved!
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
The desert giveth and the desert taketh away. It is the order of things.
Athel Loren demands vengeance, and would have you exact it.
The stronger the grip the Vampires have on society, the more docile the remaining mortal population becomes.
Alive or dead, it matters not. These creatures will serve us one way or another.
Without steel against their skin the men fall too easily.
This ancient banner is stitched together with sinew from the skins of defeated enemies.
Recent events have caused a increase in this force's movement.
Your Skink Priests have been greatly improved!
The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.
The beastmaster ensures all monsters kept aboard are looked after, in turn ensuring his crews make it through the voyage intact.
How convenient! These sacrifices were just waiting for our arrival - fetch the altar!
Men are reluctant to join the ranks of this army.
The ongoing slaughter draws nearby Minotaur tribes. They hunger for blood and battle.
Following a complicated ritual you are able to cleanse the shrine and remove the taint of the Undead from the room. You no longer have the feeling that you are under observation.
The shrine goes up in flames, taking the rest of the building with it. You torch the surrounding area also before moving on – better safe than sorry!
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Wood Elves.

Striding through the twisted network of beast-paths, the herds happen across an immense and ancient herdstone. Carved with mysterious runes, the stone records many forbidden and lost ways of Cloven Ones.
At the moment, there's plenty of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food to go around and as a result the Skaven are becoming more numerous by the day.
The warherds can cross the Old World using the secret beast-paths, increasing their movement allocation.
The Skaven's [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food supplies are running low; those who aren't in a position to demand their share are going hungry.
Alith Anar's shadow court meets only rarely, but when it does, vengeance upon the Druchii is the only real agenda.
When you endure the savagery of the north, nothing else compares.
Azhag is a threat like no other. What makes Azhag so unusual is his ominous iron crown, which emanates an ancient evil. It is this crown, a relic of olden days, which grants Azhag sorcerous powers.

Clearly, the riches of the weak belong in… nobler hands.
Destroy the land and steal its riches! Leave nothing for the vultures that'll follow - yarrr!
Your Bray-Shaman, unable to make a pilgrimage to the Heart of the Dark, instead resolves to make the Winds of Magic blow stronger across the blood-grounds!
Our artisans seem grateful... not that anyone cares if they're not!

The ferocious foreman of your logging operation has been applying the whip with unseemly zeal. Workers are vacating the camps en masse and timber production is dwindling, driving up the construction costs.
Let the swarm deal with him
There is power to be had and, by the gods, you shall have it!
The warrant admiral is ultimately responsible for many of the roles that keep the fleet running day-to-day.
Your Plague Priests have been greatly improved!
The Druchii did not expect their byways to be used against them; they retreat to their dark, barren homeland. However, Chaos' foul taint remains and must be scourged from the face of Lustria!
Our good fortune with regards to the wind means that no shore is too far away.

Faced with yet more bland rations, this army has turned to the dark practice of cannibalism... with the hearty blessing of its catering corps, of course. Now, once a battle has been won, limbs of the slain are being enthusiastically collected, salted and cured for the long road ahead, with the troops thriving on these most morbid of provisions. Replenishment rate and army movement range have increased as a result.
War or peace - it matters not, a Druchii is always a viable target. The less of their treacherous kind exist, the safer Nagarythe will be.
Loec’s ravens squawk the name of another of Malekith’s minions to slay. Their time can be measured in mere moments from now on.
Peace when the Druchii still breathe? Not for the Shadow King!
No virtuous Knight searches for gold while there is evil to root out in the Lady's blessed name!
Sycophancy is enraging. The Phoenix King shall have no part in it!

Kroq-Gar is an ancient Saurus, the last remaining warrior from the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl. The spawning that brought him into the world also produced a handful of other Saurus, each marked for greatness.
Removing this rival Beastlord's horns means he can never again challenge you, and in sparing his life you have earned the respect of your forces.
A harpoon of tempered star-metal, the only weapon strong enough to pierce the heart of Amanar...
Noctilus can utilise a heavy burst of pure Dark Magic for his own purposes.
No matter the order, our troops obey to the bitter end and beyond.
The climate in this region is suitable for your faction. There are no penalties for occupying this settlement.
Courage must be tempered with caution or losses will ensue. After all, you never know when the Vermintide will rise or the Ancient Enemy burst forth from the Realm of Chaos once more.
The peasants fight for any scraps they can take and seem satisfied, not that anyone cares...
The herd can replace their fallen with ferocious alacrity, yet the latecomers are more reluctant to fight.
Thorgrim Grudgebearer is the current High King of the Dwarfs. He is a throwback to the High Kings of old - eager for new conquests, mighty in battle, and a merciless enemy.
The concentration of your forces in this region is inflaming the rivalries within the horde.
The dead are awakening, dragging the living to hell...
The Gifts of Chaos are many and varied, each bestowing a twisted boon or warped blessing from the Ruinous Ones in return for the recipient's service.
Raids wealth and scavenges food from the local region.
You attack unexpectedly, capture the required prisoners, and rip out their hearts. The magical currents surge; the Slann Mage-Priests smile; the Great Plan advances.
He has no allies, and power corrupts the worthless anyway; let the loyal among your army deal with this traitor.
If they want to riot, then you shall riot with them. Into the fray!
To stand as the Witch King's executioner is to reach into the black heart of every Dark Elf and squeeze!
A jagged spike with the corroded remains of armoured warriors impaled; this totem spreads an aura of entropy.

A highborn Lord of Ulthuan has been captured along with his honour-guard. Naturally, they are being paraded around this province in chains before their inevitable - and exquisitely slow - public execution. The local inhabitants are ecstatic at this delicious turn of events, resulting in local improvements to public order and army leadership.
Conceals this army, allowing surprise attacks against passing enemies.

A conclave of your generals has struck upon the notion of pressing popular musicians into military service. This has come as a shock to the performers in question, but has proved an instant hit with the troops and they’re marching harder than ever before. Army movement range has increased!
The whisperings of Nagash can be heard across your lands.
The Yvresse struggle is never forgotten, and their garrison aided at any cost.

column2: The finest gunpowder to ever find its way into a drowned man's musket.
Recent events in this province have negatively affected the local population's feelings.
No Lord who spills blood for financial gain can be considered honourable.
Our populace is unhappy with our rule and have fled to other lands beyond our borders.
This liquid concoction is more effective than it looks!
What need have we of water? The sand is our source of our sustenance and power.
Rewarding the loyal Clan offers a large tithe.
Perhaps we have fallen in the estimations of others, but gold tends to ease that pain...

One of your retainers assures you that he has the perfect magical item for this job. The Mage enters the vault alone and soon after there is a huge explosion, burying him and the magical item deep beneath the ground.
Your actions are barbaric and unscrupulous. Bretonnia wilts towards obscurity.
Your followers are holding a great feast in your honour.
Our silent legion lay in wait, ready to strike unwitting fools.
This standard - an ever-rotting corpse beset by carrion birds - is a gross mockery of a scarecrow.
The creatures that serve you are made stronger by the Gods!
The rain of fire crumbles some of our warriors to dust!
This army's movement has been hindered by a foreign [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero and is on guard.

The green Warp-glow of Morrslieb, the evil moon, waxes sick and bright above this army. The Clanrats are invigorated by its viridescent energies, recovering from their wounds and replacing their numbers more swiftly than usual. Army replenishment rate has increased due to the great, weird moon's baleful influence.
There is no god a Dwarf would rather watch over them in battle; Grimnir’s gaze is directed firmly at Grombrindal’s force.
In the final analysis, he is our servant; he will feel an overwhelming urge to obey!
The Squigs have broken out of their pens, sending the Night Goblins scattering!
Belegar and his loyal followers have struck an Ancestral grudge from the great book and restored Clan Angrund to its former glory.
You can have the metal, yes-yes, but my Warlock Engineers will decipher the secrets!
The number of trade caravans has increased and the quality of its guards has plummeted, which is proving profitable for us.
Raids wealth from the local region.
Your Fimirs gain the favour of the Gods.
Grombrindal shall become a vessel through which Grungni’s wisdom is transferred to the Dwarfs, but the lands within the Karaz Ankor that will benefit will be of his own choosing.
With your plans for the Great Vortex completed, the road to total domination is now clear.
Your exploits on the high seas has led to the salvage of arcane imbued blades, enhancing your army’s combat skills.
During your adventure on the high seas you salvaged heavy armour and an arsenal of weapons.
Your escapades on the high seas have lumbered your army with a curse… losing their sanity in a blood-induced frenzy!
Your exploration of the high seas has led to blessings from the Lord of the Deeps – your troops will be protected from harm while they have the Elven God’s favour.
Your encounter on the high seas is not one the crew or troops will readily talk about, yet they have gained regenerative abilities since the event…
A recently discovered Arcane Fulcrum will greatly enhance any magic-user's power.

Karak Eight Peaks has been lost yet again to forces foul! Clan Angrund is once more dishonoured, and will be until this ancient Hold is recaptured. Until then, all Dwarfs across the Karaz Ankor will hold King Belegar personally responsible!
The corrupt forces of Chaos taint the land.
Tretch has broken a treaty - back-stabbing is an art form!
Insist that Chrace and Ellyrion dance together
The goblins are becoming a major nuisance - the Bosses will put them in their place soon enough.

Before the loss of the Eight Peaks, Belegar’s Ancestors were the kings of the nigh-impregnable fortress for many generations. The Angrund Clan is steeped in centuries of military understanding and has a keen eye for the particulars of siege warfare.

column1: You currently have units queued for recruitment.
Removing everything from the queue will cancel mustering stance.

column2: A figure of awe and influence, the Fay Enchantress is the Lady’s personal representative and, some say, the true power in Bretonnia.
The world yields to those who master the Winds of Magic.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with High Elves.

The earth is more ancient than the Elven race, and seems to favour your primacy. Perhaps it divines the gravity of the mission, and in turn reduces its own, for their troops find marching is easier and less tiring than was previously the case. Campaign movement ranges have increased factionwide as a result.
The Dark Powers have blessed you with these Chaos Spawn!
The herd is incensed and ready for war! Providing, that is, that war comes to them…
Destroying their enemies has strengthened this horde.

Across the lands of Nehekhara the sands lay still and the great cacophony of battle is silent for now. Victory is yours!
The Beastmen make an encampment hidden from outsiders, allowing the herds to recruit and replenish.
All those in this army have been chosen by Orion to join the Wild Hunt.
This settlement is recovering from a recent earthquake. Restoration efforts are underway, but the population lives in despair of the event.

The hated beard-things and hooded green-things fight above the City of Pillars, claiming it for themselves. It must be taken for Clan Mors, or risk a crippling loss of status at the Council of Thirteen.
These Skaven are your rats. There are many like them, but these ones are yours. No experiments!

column1: Units are currently queued for recruitment.

column2: Recent events have negatively affected public order.
Sacrificing these vermin has pleased the Serpent God, improving the warriors' fervour for battle.
[HIDDEN] Gives the spawned horde free upkeep
Right, you truly 'orrible lot - bring a spring upon 'her… now!!!
The Rik has sealed this Dwarfhold for the time being.

As the Great Vortex vacillates on its axis, the Winds of Magic fluctuate distressingly, eliciting wild-eyed portents of doom from hedge-wizards throughout your empire. The troops are cowed by these omens and leadership has decreased factionwide.
Recent events in this province have given the local population a reason to be happy.
A grudge has been settled and your warriors are happy.
Having recently suffered a setback, this army's effectiveness is diminished.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with Dark Elves.

A charismatic soothsayer has impassioned the locals in this province with his doctrine of vigorous procreation. While the population is sharply rising, an exhausted workforce is a not a productive one.
With your plans for the Great Vortex completed, the road to total domination is now clear.
With your plans for the Great Vortex completed, the road to total domination is now clear.
Pride always comes before a fall. These fits of ego are becoming rather expensive!
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.
Freshly-conquered territory is often unspoiled, with plentiful resources. After the Skaven get their paws on it, however, it will invariably devolve into a starved, overcrowded pit of filth.
The Dark Moon is of great importance to the Beastmen, and a chance for any Beastmen leader to guide their warherd.
Morr, the God of Death, has made raising the dead troublesome.
This army is struggling after giving up a source of fresh flesh.
The armour is indeed the work of a master armourer, and it's surprisingly light too. Your retainers have no problems recovering it from the flooded vault.
Using a series of controlled demolition charges you are able to create a new chamber to drain the water away. The plan works flawlessly and you recover the high quality armour fully intact.
The boyz look upon the new helmet with some envy.
The herd is incensed and ready for war! Providing, that is, that war comes to them…

That Lord Skrolk walks the world is an affront to nature and a sign of the power of the Great Horned Rat. Plants wither and die where Skrolk treads, and the very air about him seems to congeal and darken, as if stained by his baleful presence.
Your Runesmiths have attained knowledge even Kragg the Grim has since forgotten.
The newly-enlisted soldiers come equipped with some fine weapons that far exceed our usual, salvaged stock.
Ghouls are in abundance following a recent visitor...
Cutting the foul, sickening flesh causes great gouts of pus and slime to gush forth, tainting the earth with its repellent corruption. Stand well back!
Whilst lifting the flaps of pallid flesh one of your retainers accidentally cuts the Daemon, causing great gouts of pus and slime to gush forth, tainting the ground with foul corruption.
The Daemon tells the truth! Your warriors are all replenished by the healing properties of the tears. But of course, you always knew this boon would come at a terrible cost...
Obviously, Daemons of Chaos are not be trusted! Slaying the creature wipes the nauseating taint of its putrefaction from the ruins.
Your experts are impressed by the Skaven's grasp of technology. This is ground-breaking stuff, revealing new manufacturing methods that could be used to your advantage.
Whatever these Skaven intended, their feeble science is of little interest. The reclaimed materials are put to good use by your own artisans. There are no obvious ill effects... for now.
You order your experts glean whatever they can from it. However, their time is wasted - nothing worthwhile is discovered and your citizens are disgusted that you brought such evil into their midst.
You have the machines melted down for your own purposes. However, the metals are laced with disease that quickly kills your artisans and spreads through your population.
Many Skinks are lost, but the pestilence is contained. The Great Plan has not been overturned and the foe's designs are thwarted this day.
Kurnous is not worshipped here! Have the forest burned along with the estate… and its Lord!
Release some slaves! He who returns the most heads shall have a reward!
Mannfred is no slave to conventions of honour or glory. Ends concern him far more than means; if the choice falls between slaughtering the meek and vanquishing the mighty, he chooses slaughter.
These men are feeling confident after mopping up the stragglers from a recent battle.
Your warriors relish the opportunity to do battle with the Chaos hordes.
Those strong horse bones will improve our cavalry no end!
See how the magic swarms to our call in battle!
War comes and the Shadow King shall be at its forefront.
Although a High Elf, Anar does not play by the same rules as his noble kin; war is not just fought on the battlefield.
Those who provoke the Shadow King to war surely do not value life, for they will be deprived of it soon enough!
This pirate is in possession of one of the three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty! Surpass their Infamy to draw them out.

column1: Only through defeating them in battle can you gain this verse.

column2: Following the death of his family from the Plague of Blue Roses, Helman Ghorst plunged himself into the study of the black arts, hoping to return his brothers to life.
Alarielle the Radiant! There's no finer target than one so beautiful; Khaine will surely approve your violence against her!
The Oak has been lost. Reclaim it for the Asrai.
Grombrindal, The White Dwarf, is a legendary figure - the mightiest living Dawi warrior.
Da Boss finks yer Gobbos are ded good.
